message.body: i'm in
hhes, good idea
channels wouldn't work. not a true irc, but the json would be useful to work with
but doesn't that mean private messages will be stored?
the ideal scenario with storage would be a zero-knowledge framework
for all messages
but I wouldn't know where to start on the implementation
hhes, ah, so you mean pm's will be routed to zeromail
i think we're talking at cross purposes
i don't think it should be everyone's responsibility to store privatemessages (even if encrypted)
right, so this is a real problem
i think it shouldn't be implemented. not with zeromail already available
but that's anyone's decision, if they decide to implement it, they can do so. I just think it's not a good idea
here's an idea
if you intend to implement a zerochat private messaging feature, it should do the following:
each pm is a "room" that links two users and only those two users
so a pm in effect "spawns" a room
if it doesn't already exist for those two users
that way, those users can rest assured that they're the only ones who 1) read and 2) store the messages
the rooms' spawning means that those two users are the ones who participate in that "room"
ergo: they're the only two who store it
but I'm trying to think of a way to avoid propagation for pm's
only two users need to know about the pms for any given pair of users
so let's say I try to pm someone. that would in effect "create" a room locally for me and the intended recipient
hhes, ok then we can stop before we start :P
it's ok. there's plenty to do without im's
i'm an autodidact, so I'm willing to work on anything
I could give it a go on focusing on giving it a more 0net UI like ZeroBoard or something
yeah, i need something to hack on, so I'll see what I can work on
ui-wise, that is
uh, sure
:P
i've been getting my pixel setup for dev work, so i've been slow in getting stuff started
Chromebook Pixel 2015 :D
I already have a 12core arch box; its my moble
feature idea (like weechat): sending "s/text/newtext" will correct user's prior message matching the rule
same

rebranding: before we get too far on our way with a name that might not be the best choice (e.g., "ZeroChatIRC" = ZeroChat Internet Relay Chat) we should consider a more widely useful name, like ZeroNetRelayChat or NullChat or something, because it is far from being an IRC, since it lives entirely on 0net
0net Relay Chat = ORC :D
s/ORC/0RC
0RC = 0net Relay Chat seems best unless we want something different or what we already have
seems like it's pretty unique and simpel
yeah, 0rc works, too
